Embedded_text:
Yesterday in my QnA when I asked the question: 
What has Coronavirus taught you?

One guy replied: 
"Chu**yon se daro, chunotiyo se nahi"

This just changed my perspective to LIFE. Left a dent on me permanantly.

Expect portals like Aaj Tak to be completely rejected by the younger gen moving forward. It will take some time to weed out this poison from the minds of the rural youth as well. But it will happen in due time.

Absolute garbage journalism on display.
Yeah sex and all is great but have you ever planned something very detailed and the execution turned out to be exactly the same way step-by-step?

Just crossed 10,000 followers on Twitter. 
Small number in general, but fairly big feat personally.

Feel that if I'm out here grooming budding creators, I should walk the creator journey myself too.

Journey has just started, lots more content coming your way.

Thank you!

Unpopular opinion:

Don't listen to parents for career advice. 

They aren't updated with the best career options. Neither are their friends who they base their opinions off.

They only want you to be happy and secure. If you can assure that for yourself, they will come around.
Don't work with people who compliment you all the time. Work with people who complement you all the time.
The quickest way to lose your money is to keep it all to yourself.
WhatsApp Web is actually my most favourite productivity tool.
If you really want to be a leader, distance yourself from the credit.

Daytime is for operations. Night time is for creativity.

Night time is for dreaming. Day time is for acting on those dreams.

Two types of people on August 15:

Type 1: India is the greatest nation of all time. Nothing like India. Show me a better country and I will change my name.

Type 2: Guys, today we really need ask ourselves, after 73 years of freedom, are we REALLY independent?

Who's cutting the damn onions here man.

#DhoniRetires

Pro tip:

Follow your friend's girlfriend/boyfriend on Instagram only once they get married.
Cannot even begin to imagine the amount of fire-fighting Elon Musk does being the CEO of not one but TWO mammoth companies, both of which are attempting something never-done-before.

Human behaviour 101

Tweet something really deep, wise and thoughtful: 
2 comments, 5 RTs, 10 likes.

Tweet something basic that everyone already knows:
50 comments agreeing with you, 500 RTs, 4000 likes.

Kids in the comment section:
Bsdk chal paka mat

Creator replies.

Same kid:
Bhai bhai bhai thnk u for the reply.
Almost 25 years into life and 3 years into working, still get butterflies before an important call.
Do you use WhatsApp more than Instagram to text your friends or are you normal?
Indian YouTube needs a popular real estate channel.

Instagram DM needs a reply option to each message.

My friends are out here sending me 10 memes in 5 seconds. I only end up replying to the last one.
Female friends give you perspectives, life hacks, insights, advice that male friends just do not have.
Comedy gold.
My friends in Bengaluru take more pride about the fact that they have Dunzo in their city than Parisians do about the Eiffel Tower or New Yorkers about the Statue of Liberty.
Do anything, but don't ever be THIS bitter in life. It serves absolutely no one, not even your own self.
Byju Raveendran so alpha he built a startup named after himself and made it the most valued EdTech startup in the world.

Apple store launched online in India.

Wait so you're telling us that the one reason we stayed in touch with our friends and relatives in the US has now been taken away from us?

Sounds good to me.
Arnab Goswami would've been a very successful YouTuber. He's insanely good with the clickbaits

We talk a lot about dad humour but honestly Indian mom humour needs its own hype. 

Indian moms have some of the funniest punchlines ever.

WhatsApp needs to reschedule its time to backup my messages to a time when I'm asleep. 

Like 9AM or something. Not 2AM.

Oh man they wouldn't be able to make a show like The Office in today's time. 

Too much offense would be taken. By a lot of people.
We're definitely going to witness the highest viewership on IPL this year.

I blindly trust people the first time.

If they wrong me once, I let it slide and count it as a mistake.

If they do it twice, it was intentional and they're taking advantage. This time they're out.

...But if they reciprocate the trust, that's the start of something beautiful.
Today I learned that Quora reads my Google search history and sends me app notifications pertaining to the questions I ask on Google.
Sometimes I just feel like I could go back and intern at some companies I look up to. The joy of learning while being a fly on the wall is different.
It's 2020 and some Mumbaikars in their fancy ass cars are still throwing their plastic cups out of the window.

0 to 10,000 followers: 
1.5 years of active tweeting (or 10 years since joining Twitter)

10,000 to 20,000 followers: 
Less than 90 days

Power of compounding and active content creation.

Do you think we can now expect Indian PUBG clones the way we had for TikTok?

Discuss.

20,000 on Twitter soon. 

Beyond blessed to have a community that engages, debates, agrees/disagrees, retweets with such frequency and passion.

We keep learning everyday.

Went on a trek.

Drank water directly from water source.

Pure water tastier than most sugary energy drinks.

Pure water rejuvenates and heals like nothing else in the world.
Are you even a startup guy if you don't have  in your bio.

Too much glamourization around changing the world with your startup/business. 

At the core, the goal of a business is to be profitable. Do it in an ethical way and you're changing the worlds of many around you.
Don't be a founder, if you can't deal with confrontation.
Man who knew chess streaming would have such a loyal and fairly widespread audience.
Apparently, good grammar is so scarce on dating apps that no one is looking for a good partner, just for good grammar.
Waiting for Baba Dhaba's YourStory and Inc42 article about raising fresh funds from VCs to come out any time now.

Most Mumbai University students pick MS in US not because they want to dive deeper into engineering, but because it's an easier and more lucrative option than MBA in India or an entry-level job in India.

On the eve of my 25th birthday, I have collaborated with the Maharashtra government to enable a holiday for the entire state. 

No more Monday blues on my watch. You're welcome.

Actively learn to hang out with people from who come from different backgrounds, upbringing, social stratas, perspectives and follow different religions and beliefs.

I will never understand why Indians go to foreign countries and only end up hanging out with Indians even there.
Modern Family is an extremely underrated show.
Nothing more painful than watching Nirav Modi's episode on Bad Boy Billionaires and then just moments later, getting an alert from the IT Dept to file for my taxes to avoid penalty.

Sex and all is great but have you ever made a cryptic, impossible-to-interpret, multi-layered joke in a group chat but your friends still end up getting it? 

That hits different.
If you're a salesperson, do not make a cold call on a Monday morning. That's literally the worst time to catch a potential client you haven't spoken to before.
I think the real reason India has so many festivals is so that our diabetic Boomer parents can have an excuse to eat all the sweets in the world they like.
Lawyers are honestly some of the best conversationalists.
Downloaded Hinge yesterday and it is literally everyone who loves wine, dogs & pizza and is on the lookout of someone who can handle their sass and sarcasm.
If you're putting someone on a pedestal thinking you'll be able to impress them or get your work done, you're doing it wrong.

Finally turned 25. 

Is this the right time to start having an existential crisis or am I doing it all wrong?
I'm 25 years old and I still get nightmares about studying the wrong subject for an exam and they 100% wake me up every damn time.
I enjoy silence a lot. Unhealthy amounts of it sometimes.
Sometimes the best way to get over issues in your personal life is literally to get yourself busy in your professional one.

20-22 year olds really underestimate the value of compounding. They don't get themselves acquainted with basics of investing thinking I'll start when I earn a handful.

Terrible mistake. Start investing when you make your first penny.
No amount of money, possessions, materialistic wealth matter if you can't sleep like a baby at night.

Money cannot buy happiness: 

Money can get you the freedom to order food without having your parents to look at the price column while out on a family dinner:

Still can't believe I used to travel 3 hours every day to work. Never going back to doing that again. 

Happiness quotient is on another level.
It's crazy the kind of doors that get opened if just one person puts in a good word for you in the right place.

Was just thinking of celebrities who have no haters? And only one name pops in my mind always - Rahul Dravid.

Anyone else?
I don't think anyone gets more birthday tributes in India than Shah Rukh Khan and Sachin.

I think Indian parents genuinely love their house help a lot more than their own kids. 

What's funny is I think it's completely valid.
Indian weddings are hunting grounds for finding potential grooms and brides for the eligible bachelors next in line.
The biggest productivity hack I have is plugging in to some feel good music before doing a task I have tried evading since a while.

When you become a public figure, 

you gain fame, money, power, relationships, adulation, free gifts.

you lose freedom.
Clearly, Twitter and Instagram have hit puberty with all the changes they're going through every second day.

Doesn't matter how hard you try, you cannot press that shirt better than the local laundry guy and you cannot get a shave better than your local hairdresser.

Both of them are forms of art in their own right.
Diego Maradona - the guy who gave everyone around the world and especially short guys the confidence that you can be an absolute boss in life. Height no bar.

No joy in the world better than roasting your friends for the most brutal things about their lives.

The best part? Them reciprocating with equal harshness.

I changed my DP on Bumble from a normal tshirt to a traditional Diwali photo, got 5x matches within 24 hours.

Anyone want to take a shot at justifying this?
Life is hard on you if you're not hard on yourself.

The biggest irony with the "ultra woke" is that they preach mental health and therapy all day long but one disagreement with their beliefs and they won't wait a moment to pounce on you, call you all sorts of expletives and cancel you.

So much for open-mindedness and empathy.
Being an overprotective parent is the absolute worst thing you can do to your child.

One of my best career moves was to get active on Twitter. 

There is zero downside to being active on Twitter and unbelievable upside if you are consistent.

I think marriage just really makes the Indian cricketers gentler.

Kohli got a lot more composed and mature on-field post his marriage. 

Pandya is passing on his award to a fellow player.

Start applauding the wives for this, like we've been hating on them when we lose.

Normal employees: 
Write an email to HR

Google employees: 
Fuck it, Gmail is going down first.

I think BITS has the best alumni network in the country right now. By a mile. 

Half of my tech Twitter is from BITS. Huge advantage.

One of the biggest blessings of work-from-home is you get to eat fresh, warm, home-cooked food every day for lunch.
The magnitude of misinformation about whey protein in the average Indian household is laughable and frankly very sad.

Call them whatever you want but it would be foolish to deny the marketing genius of the Kardashian family. 

Going viral is one thing. Sustaining the virality and relevance while building multiple million dollar businesses is a whole different ballgame.

Today, we hit a community of 30,000 followers.

3 growth hacks that worked for me:

1. Be super honest with your thoughts. People want raw content.

2. Tweet about your niche but also about random things you wish to talk about/find interesting.

3. Tweet actively.

Tweet something very insightful, thought-provoking, and wise

5 likes, 0 RTs.

Tweet something basic like "I can't believe it's December already?!?!?! RT if you relate"

550K likes, 1M RTs.

Netflix knows that Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives will get a lot of hate on YouTube but will also be heavily watched on Netflix.

That's just how reality shows work. As humans, we are obsessed with the personal lives of others.

Same reason why vlogs RULE on YouTube.

Indian moms would make some of the best salespeople in the world.

They negotiate ruthlessly in every aspect of life.

Massive untapped potential here.

I'm hoping you have a better conversation starter than "Hey"

My matches on Bumble:
Hi...

Anxious about a call you want to make? Make it.

Anxious about asking your crush out? Message them, don't delay it.

If you have just launched your brand, do not consider influencer marketing to start with.

Build a quality sales funnel via performance marketing and word-of-mouth.

Only once you need more reach and visibility along with leads, opt for influencer marketing.

Your behaviour and tone should not change depending on the position of the person in the organization.

When someone does a favour for you, ensure you return the favour.

It's just how the world works. No one likes a freeloader.

Sold a stock that was 30% down for a year a little too early. Thought I was the smartest trader in the room when I sold it and it went down by 5%. 

Within 4 days, it has now fully recovered and is up 10%. The market teaches you humility like nothing else does.

Help each other out in whatever possible way that you can. We're our only hope.

Donated plasma today. Found a local blood bank and registered with them. I recovered from COVID a month ago, hence I was eligible.

Request you guys to pay it forward if you are eligible as well. Nothing better than playing a small role in helping save someone's life.

Stay safe.

If you want to help, this is what you can do:

1. Call the numbers that are floating on social media.
2. Verify their legitimacy. 
3. If they are legitimate, speak to them and build a rapport.
4. Every time you see an urgent requirement on SM, connect the two.

URGENT:

Need Remdesivir in Surat, Gujarat very urgently for a friend's mum who has COVID.

Please reach out if you have any leads. Please RT for reach.

Thank you

Yes, it will break your spirit and dampen your morale.

But if you're fit physically and mentally. The nation needs you.

Help in whatever capacity you can.
Don't just flow through life. Take charge. Build your own reality.
Building something from scratch is great, sustaining it is even better.
Your worst failures will be fantastic stories to tell only if you don't let those moments of failure shatter your spirit to start all over again.
